intro: Pilosella buhsei, commonly known as the Buhse's hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella buhsei is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
